title: The Wall Street Journal: Treasury says regulators need power to seize, unwind failing banks
text:
WASHINGTON—The Trump administration recommended retaining the government’s power to seize and unwind a failing financial firm in a crisis, departing from some conservative Republican lawmakers and endorsing a plank of the 2010 Dodd-Frank financial law.
The Treasury Department, in a report Wednesday, called for changes to correct what it described as “serious defects” around how and when so-called orderly liquidation authority, or OLA, would be used. As expected, it said the authority should be retained as a tool for the government...
